intro: Trigynia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered trigynia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Trigynia parviflora is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, water-storing leaves.
